pr_title: Rationalize some ThreadPool Use in Snapshot Transport Actions

timeline.message:
Rationalize some ThreadPool Use in Snapshot Transport Actions

Removing a few spots where we clearly don't have to fork to the generic or management
pool since either we only interpret the current cluster state or fork-off directly to
some other pool in the transport action logic anyway.

timeline.bodyText: First step of creating a snapshot nowadays is putting the init state snapshot in the CS => forking to the CS thread right away anyway
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Forks straight to the snapshot thread under the hood
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Only looks at the CS and that's it.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: getMultipleReposSnapshotInfo forks to the generic pool for every individual repo in the response, no need to fork setting up the task for each repo.
